segments.text: I see the woman standing in the puddle, still drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even seem to notice the water or the kids behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching so high, balancing on that stool like it’s nothing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just waiting, so patient, like this happens all the time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still running, and the sink is completely overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman is just ignoring it or if she really doesn’t see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so chaotic, but she’s just standing there, calm as can be.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is going to tip, and the floor is so wet—someone is going to get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, it’s a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how unaware she is of everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR
